## R Markdown
```{r,include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(lubridate)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
setwd("C:/Users/Leo/Desktop/LOWE Institute/Lowe Projects/Airbnb_Article")
sfMay <- read.csv("SF_May_Listings.csv")
```

**Describing the SF Listing Data in One Variable**
```{r}
sfMay%>%filter(minimum_nights<181)%>%ggplot()+geom_bar(mapping = aes(x=minimum_nights))+ggtitle("Distribution of Minimum Night Required Stay in SF Listings")
sfMay%>%mutate(first_review_date=as_date(first_review))%>%ggplot(mapping = aes(x=first_review_date))+geom_histogram()+ggtitle("Distribution of Date of first listing")
sfMay%>%mutate(first_review_date=as_date(first_review))%>%ggplot(aes(x=first_review_date))+stat_ecdf(geom="step")+ggtitle("Cumulative distribution of listings by date")
```
